main event: On 29th August 1959 at 0555Z in St. Johns, Newfoundland, civilian pilots witnessed a straight light traveling straight down for 2 minutes.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 2 minutes, providing a significant duration for the sighting.
The report lists possible explanations as balloon, aircraft, astronomical, and very high meteor.
The pilots were flying PAA-Clipper 125-Boeing 727 at 33,220' and KLM-DC-7 at 21,000' when the sighting occurred.
The observation was made over Torbay Airport, and the senior controller initially thought it might be a falling star.
The report concludes with 'POSSIBLE FALLING STAR' as the assessment.
sighted object: a straight light traveling straight down
photographs: no photographs included in the report
